title: Yo! Pyke is black!
body:
Riot your character design is just getting better and better. I really like that you have a diverse cast of characters that have different stories, backgrounds and even ethnicities! As a black man, I really like that i am being represented more and more in the gaming community. And since league is my favorite game right now, This really excites me. Great work riot!                    
{{sticker:slayer-pantheon-thumbs}}

EDIT: So apprently he's most likely not black, most likely similar to Illaoi {{champion:420}} However i even appreciate this. Representation of all races matter in games, not just black males like me. 

EDIT: Alright we need to clear this up. I’m not categorizing him and just purely based on his race, I like the characters design. I’m sorry that your race isn’t being represented, in my eyes, that is an issue and I was just excited about my race being represented more. I think representation matters because it just helps people relate to their character more. And I think it just feels nice to see your skin color in the media.

LAST EDIT: Apparently, he is black! A black man from bilgewater! Diversity ftw!

replies.body: tbh I'm not sure if he's black or if he's that color because he's dead via drowning /:l
He's skin isn't dark from being tan or dead or anything. He is just a black guy from Bilgewater. As a port city, Bilgewater has many people with different cultures and skin colors that call it home.

> [{quoted}](name=BonzaiBuddy,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=A2sEakEY,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2018-05-15T04:11:29.223+0000)

Hell, he even does the Maori intimadation dance thing.

I recall posts here and there with players enjoying {{champion:39}} or {{champion:50}} or {{champion:145}} bearing a resemblance to them irl.

Someone even made a thread asking for a champ possessing a middle eastern look like Rashid from Street Fighter 5

People like to see themselves in the champs they play. It's really just that simple.

I understand that,i like playing more male than female champs,especially cause some female champs are designed rather poorly like Kai Sa you mentioned,i mean,you survive the most hostile environment and you come out wearing a THONG,make up and spandex looking all beautiful with no scars,no burn marks,no symbiotic parasite crawling around your body talking to you,you just look like a hot 20 year old model in a combat suit with a thong. It just feels tacky,especially in a game focused on combat.

That being said,this line, " Riot your character design is just getting better and better. I really like that you have a diverse cast of characters that have different stories, backgrounds and even ethnicities! " is quite interesting

Obviously the focus here is on "ethnicities"since riot always had a pretty diverse character stories and backgrounds for their champs and i honestly don't think how good character design is should be gauged on features like Sex/Race.

Like i said i prefer male champs more cause i identify with them easier and i personally feel more of them are designed better but i wouldn't praise riot and say a champ is a good design and that their design is getting better and better just cause the champ is a male nor would i think its a bad design just cause the champ is female,i mean {{champion:67}} {{champion:429}}{{champion:55}}  are to me some of the cooler champs of league,they have a strong theme,they look mean,they look ready for battle,they're warriors,killers,not hot girls in thongs that feels a lot like fan service.

The irony though is even though i think {{champion:145}}  design is shit,i still really like her a lot just cause of her gameplay,and that's what it all boils down to i guess

Dude, what? They didn't make every champ black / asian.

You're not making any sense here.

I don't get it, you're pissed that a minority is getting represented because it's not _your_ minority? Get in line buddy. Lots of people are underrepresented. Throwing a hissy fit about it doesn't make you somehow more important than them.
Taliyah is middle eastern always thought she was Arabic or Egyptian. Karma is more Indian than anything.  Illaoi is Polynesian. Twitch is a rat xD

Also Kai'Sa and Sivir are Shuriman too (even though they're "white passing") which would equate to Middle Eastern. Which is fine since Middle Eastern people can look white, but it's somewhat disappointing when Riot has an opportunity to create women of color they go for white passing, but it's whatever.

So basically, "Either champion diversity all the way or be insensitive to ALL minorities." You're literally advocating for Riot to ignore diversity, and you're advocating for this out of spite against other groups who have gotten more representation than your own group.

Are you aware that this sort of in-fighting with fellow minorities is exactly what people in power want you to do? Waste your energy advocating against each other while they make rules and write themselves/each-other fat checks.

Don't hate dude, people are just excited about something. **Advocate _for yourself_, not _against others_.**

> [{quoted}](name=BBagz,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=A2sEakEY,comment-id=000b00000000000000000000000000000000,timestamp=2018-05-15T22:23:34.805+0000)
>
> Except those minorities push their agenda over everyone. The non-oppressed minorities, blacks, asians and jews, push their shit onto everyone else.

I've never seen that happen. To categorize those groups as if they collectively choose to do something negative to other groups... that's a load of bullshit.

Your rhetoric smells funny. I bet you're one of those white dudes who pretends to champion minorities but really just argue offensively to make people think badly about the group you pretend to represent.

The idea that most black people aren't for (or are actively against) other PoC is ridiculous. 

I'm black and I'm salty af at all the opportunities for PoC champions Riot has missed in the recent past.

For example, Kai'sa is a "white passing" Shuriman, which equates to Middle Eastern irl. I'm not really mad since Middle Eastern people can be white or white passing irl, but it kinda disappoints/irks me because it was an opportunity to add another WoC in the roster. Same can be said for Sivir who is ambiguous/white passing.

Another example is Rakan and Xayah who are Ionian which parallels Asia. However, Xayah is racially ambiguous and Rakan is clearly white. Once again, I'm not really mad because it doesn't defy logic since they're magical creatures who can adapt their physical appearance so race doesn't really apply to them. Having said that, Xayah and Rakan are from Ionia (which parallels Asia) and they're humanoid, so it would be a great opportunity to represent Asian people. Instead they made Rakan look Scandinavian. 

I felt the same way when they first revealed Kayn but after his backstory came out and explained he was a child soldier form Noxus originally who ended up in Iona, I felt that way less so. However, I still see it as a missed opportunity Asian representation cause he could've easily been a child soldier form Ionia.

> The idea [as proposed by BBagz] that most black people aren't for (or are actively against) other PoC is ridiculous [as proposed by me].

>I don't see why that would mean you would have to be upset at other minorities for said opportunities being given to them instead.

I'm not upset at other minorities getting opportunities. I'm upset at Riot missing opportunities to represent other minorities.

> I'm confused, I thought increased diversity was good, regardless of which minorities got the representation.

It is, which is why I'm arguing for representation of ALL minorities (as per my examples) and refuting BBagz supposition that black people (of which I am one) are only for black representation and/or against other minority representation (which I'm clearly not as per my examples). 

> And Riot is more focused on creating a diverse roster of champions than on catering to diverse representation.

Which I agree with.


> Good examples, and I kind of get it. But I still don't understand why it's okay to be upset with other minorities.

I'm not upset with other minorities. I'm upset with Riot for not including other minorities when they've had numerous opportunities to do so.

Hope this clears this up, sorry for the confusion.

yes, it does clear things up! I'm sorry for misunderstanding before. PugsOrFeed (the OP) also helped to clear up the misunderstanding.

Thanks for participating in the discussion!

Before we get any further into this I want to be clear about my race so you don't get the wrong idea. I'm white.

"no one is racist towards them"

You seem to be allowing your frustration (with how middle easterners are treated) to blind you to the racism that blacks suffer. Just because their experience is different from yours does not somehow make theirs invalid.

Listen bud, you have every right to be upset, culture is fucked up and (presumably) your race being painted as the bad guys in every shooter game for the past 10 years is really shitty. But don't take it out on people who had nothing to do with it. They didn't do anything to you, and wasting time advocating against them is not going to do _anything_ to help.

I'm still not convinced that you're not just some white dude trying to make middle easterners look bad. The way you're advocating against minorities and the type of rhetoric you use against them is just way too similar to that of white supremacists.

> Then on top of that, the companies say they are being diverse while over representing blacks, asians and whites while not including middle easterns and latinos. Do you not understand how annoying that is? Riot acts like they like diversity and shove 20 blacks and asians in the game while ignoring every other race.

I haven't seen Riot claim to make a racially diverse roster. They're certainly not bragging about it if they have. I think that you're getting upset at the wrong people and you're getting a little too worked up over this.

> I wish I was white. Why would anyone pretend they are middle eastern? I literally just experienced racism today because I am middle eastern so I am hot headed about this shit. You gotta look at it from my perspective. Imagine being a minority and have your race depicted as the bad guys and then another minority group is put in as the heroes and the company that made the game says the game is filled with diversity.

Ok, either you're playing dumb or you aren't aware of the bot wars on twitter. Some white supremacist groups were making fake accounts and pretending to be minorities and then going into threads discussing race and racism and acting like jerks, just to make people think that that minority were all jerks. Then someone got wise to it and made a bot to find and expose those impersonators and then the white supremacists made their own bots to track and stop such efforts. It was a whole mess and it's probably still ongoing.

I don't think that being middle eastern makes one hot headed. Being hot-headed is simply common among humans, especially those who happen to be young-ish and/or male (not assuming anything, just making a point). I have looked at it from your perspective, like I said before you have every right to be upset. But you've got to learn how to funnel that anger into being productive. Lashing out against other minorities just because they have things a little better off than you do will not help anything.

Edit: we're almost out of reply space, if one of your comments appears directly parallel to mine (and not nested inside it) then you'll have to make a new reply to one of my comments farther up the chain for me to get a notification that you've replied.

Honestly, I'd never even thought about the damn racial issues before looking at this thread. Why can't you just say "well written character" than just "black". This is really shallow one-dimentional profiling. Especially when Riot made this champ for months.

Its basically similar as looking at Leonardo Da VInci's last supper and saying, "15 Jews".

Thinking about "race" or "gender" first when you see a video game character is not a healthy sign.

... No one thought about that first? When Pyke was first teased, people speculated as to what his personality, backstory, kit, etc. would be like. Now that we can see him in a decent light, this guy (and probs more) are just like "oh, neato. this is a nice surprise." 

It's not that deep.

~~also considering we dont have his full lore or vo yet we cant really comment on how well written he is so~~
When people lose their minds every time [insert minority character] *exists* in media, it's hard to say that representation doesn't matter.
